source.author: Jeanes, J.A.; Jobson, P.C.
source.title: Rosaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A.; Jobson, P.C. (1996). Rosaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lower surface of leaves, inflorescences and sepals glabrous; margins crenulate, not revolute
Lower surface of leaves, inflorescences and sepals white-tomentose; margins entire and revolute
Leaves mostly less than 10 mm wide, rarely to 15 mm wide and if so then more than 5 cm long, 4 or more times as long as wide
Leaves mostly more than 10 mm wide, up to 3 times as long as wide
Young shoots rusty-pubescent; leaves oblong to oblong-oblanceolate
Young shoots white or grey-pubescent; leaves oblanceolate to obovate
